messages.msgSnippet: ... I m pretty sure I saw a pretty extensive demo of that on line. Probably at the website of the designers of Rosetta Stone. It should be easy to find with
messages.messageBody:
on 4/1/03 7:43 AM, Angela at unschooling@... wrote:

> My girls and I really enjoy the Rosetta Stone program. You learn a lot
> just playing it for fun. Billy has it at fun books. For $20 you can
> get the first 22 or so lessons and see if you like it.
> www.fun-books.com

I'm pretty sure I saw a pretty extensive demo of that on line. Probably at
the website of the designers of Rosetta Stone. It should be easy to find
with Google.

Joyce

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Spanish
messages.msgSnippet: My girls and I really enjoy the Rosetta Stone program.  You learn a lot just playing it for fun.  Billy has it at fun books.  For $20 you can get the first 22
messages.messageBody:
My girls and I really enjoy the Rosetta Stone program. You learn a lot
just playing it for fun. Billy has it at fun books. For $20 you can
get the first 22 or so lessons and see if you like it.
www.fun-books.com

Angela in Maine





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Spanish
messages.msgSnippet: ... If you have cable internet, he might enjoy listening to a radio station from Spain or Latin America.  The more the language feels familiar to him, the
messages.messageBody:
> My son (12 1/2) is interested in a computer program to help him learn
> Spanish. We tried a couple from the library, but they were boring. Does
> anyone know of a good computer program that might interest him?

If you have cable internet, he might enjoy listening to a radio station from
Spain or Latin America. The more the language feels familiar to him, the
easier it will be to actually speak it at some point. There might be TV
shows in Spanish where you live as well.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Spanish
messages.msgSnippet: My son (12 1/2) is interested in a computer program to help him learn Spanish.  We tried a couple from the library, but they were boring.  Does anyone know of
messages.messageBody:
My son (12 1/2) is interested in a computer program to help him learn
Spanish. We tried a couple from the library, but they were boring. Does
anyone know of a good computer program that might interest him?

Thanks,
Carol
